airlineinterface

Class Flight

  • java.lang.Object
    • airlineinterface.Flight

  • public class Flight
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Flight(java.lang.String departure, java.lang.String destination, java.lang.String flightRef, java.lang.String carrier, int maxPassengers, float maxWeight, float maxVolume)
      The Flight object holds all the relevant data of a single flight.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Flight

        public Flight(java.lang.String departure,
              java.lang.String destination,
              java.lang.String flightRef,
              java.lang.String carrier,
              int maxPassengers,
              float maxWeight,
              float maxVolume)
       throws exceptions.InvalidValueException
        The Flight object holds all the relevant data of a single flight.
        Parameters:
        departure - the starting location name
        destination - the finishing location name
        flightRef - the unique flight code
        carrier - the carrier company providing the flight
        maxPassengers - the maximum number of passengers this flight can hold
        maxWeight - the maximum weight of customer luggage this flight can hold
        maxVolume - the maximum volume of customer luggage this flight can hold
        Throws:
        exceptions.InvalidValueException - when any of the input values are either empty, null or if the integer values are below zero (except maxPassengers which refuses values less than OR EQUAL TO zero

    • Method Detail

      • addCustomer

        public boolean addCustomer(Customer c)
                    throws exceptions.InvalidValueException
        Adds a new customer to the flight's passenger list.
        Parameters:
        c - the new customer to add to the flight
        Returns:
        if the input customer is a new entry, this method returns True. If this customer does already exist, this method will take no action and return false.
        Throws:
        exceptions.InvalidValueException - when the customer's flight code does not match with this flight's code (i.e the customer is trying to check into the wrong flight)

      • removeCustomer

        public boolean removeCustomer(Customer c)
        Removes a customer from the flight's passenger list.
        Parameters:
        c - the customer to remove from the flight
        Returns:
        e input customer exists in the list, it is removed and this method returns True. If this customer does not exist in the list, this method will take no action and return false.

      • getMaxAttributes

        public float[] getMaxAttributes()
        Returns:
        the flight's maximum flight attributes in the following order: maximum number of passengers, the maximum allowed weight of luggage, and the maximum holding volume

      • getCustomerSumAttributes

        public float[] getCustomerSumAttributes()
        Returns:
        the flight's current flight attributes of all the customers in the following order: current number of passengers, the total weight of luggage, and the total volume of luggage

      • getTravelPoints

        public java.lang.String[] getTravelPoints()
        Returns:
        a two-cell array for the travelling point of the flight: starting location, and finishing location

      • getCarrier

        public java.lang.String getCarrier()
        Returns:
        the name of the company providing the flight
